attributes.comment:
I am very disappointed to see that not only does it appear that you are not
considering extending the timeline for the I171H for adopting families, but now you
are considering raising the fees for this document. This is one of the most
stressful, as well as most expensive document required for families that are
adopting internationally. There are some families that will end up having to apply
for this document 3 times for one adoption because of waiting times right now.
For most families the cost of this document the first time around, along with the
biometric fees is a huge financial burden. But since the expiration of these
documents isn't close to being along the same wait times we are experiencing
right now, it creates stress in how long you could wait for this document(for some
states 12 weeks waiting) and the cost is just overwhelming. It doesn't seem as
though you have a reasonable rationale for such a significant increase. I would
hope you would reconsider the fee increase, and understand that for most this is
already a very large sum of money, and to have to be responsible for that cost
multiple times is really too much to ask(when this is the same information being
submitted) You should be able to streamline this process, and then you would not
have to raise fees. The same for biometrics. Our fingerprints will be the same as
they were 15 months ago. With computer technology it would seem as though
you would be able to keep them on file for a bit longer. You would then need less
workers in your service centers if they were not having to redo fingerprints for US
citizens that have already had a FBI clearance, local and state police clearance,
CPS clearance, and have passed a state certified home study. We are not the
people the USCIS or the Dept of Homeland Security should be worrying about.
So this would save your department money right off the bat, and raising fees would
not be necessary.
Thank You for your time and consideration. Julie & David Rockaway
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Julie D. Rockaway
